root: ^You and Amelia walk through the thickets of the rainforests.
^I don’t know about this - a lot of humans live in these parts.
^I would honestly rather chance it with the plants,
^but if you think we might be able to find some ship parts, I won’t stop.
^Do you want to head into the clearing?
^Yes, we can't afford to waste time.
^No better to be safe than sorry

choiceNobettertobesafethansorry: ^You and Amelia move on past the clearing, and deeper into the woods.
^Ahead of you lies some barbed vines blocking your way. Venus flytrap-like plants stand on either side of the vines, menacingly.
^Do you try to hack through them?
choiceNothanks: ^It would most likely be futile anyway.
choiceSurewhynot: ^You and Amelia attempt to hack and slash and bite through the vines, but to no avail.
^The venus fly trap plants start to growl.
^It would likely be futile—and hazardous—to keep going.
^Well it looks like we can’t go any further in that way.
^Breathe fire? No. Maybe an ember or two, but that’s about it.
^I would have to practice for like a gajillion hours
^to be able to breathe even one large flame.
^And we don't have the time for that right now.
^So can we please go somewhere else?
choiceYeswecantaffordtowastetime: ^You and Amelia enter the clearing, and spot several treetops.
^An elderly figure jumps down from the tallest tree to block your way.
^State your name and your purpose. Now.
^We don’t want any trouble, we’re just passing through. speaker: Amelia
^Wouldn’t be the first time an outsider came through with that story.
^Several cloaked figures in masks appear from the trees and crowd around Noelle and Amelia, spears raised.
^It appears that you’re in a tight spot. How do you wish to deescalate the situation:
choiceSaynothing: ^You heard her the first time. Now let us leave.
^I can’t have outsiders knowing where we live.
choiceSaythetruth: ^My name is Noelle Tempest, and this is Amelia.
^My ship capsized on shores not far from this settlement,
^and we only wish to gather parts necessary to build a new ship capable of escaping the approaching floods.
^Please, I beg you, let us leave, and we will never disturb your peace again.
^and you have my sympathy for being marooned the way you have been.
^Don’t think I heard you properly the first time.
^and you both know where we live now.
^You are free to contribute to our community,
^But your life outside of this settlement ends today.
^You don’t understand though— the floods are coming!
^The water’s rising around here as we speak!
^Surely someone as supposedbly in tune with the land as you are
^Oh I am already aware of the floods.
^we live high enough in the treetops that our home is at no risk of being washed away.
^Do you really think being a little bit higher off the ground is gonna save you?
^And even if we all ultimately perish, such is the circle of life.
^And you have no issue about putting everyone’s lives on the line?
^I don’t see the harm in trusting in the natural order.
^Whether we live or die isn’t our choice after all.
^Besides, we live with the land, we only take what we need.
^To try to uproot everything we hold dear just to resist the call of The Great Disaster is sacrilege.
^The Great Disaster is going to kill us all!
^All I hear is two outsiders shouting about things they do not understand.
^But that will fade in time I’m sure.
^For now, take a look around, and get to know us.
^After all, whether you like it or not, this is your home now.
^The cloaked figures jump up the rope ladders—all but one. Instead they move to the entrance of the settlement, blocking the only exit out.
^The elder slowly climbs up the middle rope ladder, leaving Amelia and Noelle alone.
